system.description:
• Your Strength, Constitution, or Intelligence score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • Half your berserker levels count as bloodblade levels for the purpose of the @UUID[Compendium.a5e-bloody-heretics.bloody-heretics.Item.BN530ktKxe54Qs8x]{Frenzied Fury} and @UUID[Compendium.a5e-bloody-heretics.bloody-heretics.Item.DhH2HdUvPQYNIbWE]{Accelerated Recovery} features.
  • Whenever you reduce a creature with a CR equal to at least half your character level to 0 hit points, treat it as an instance of the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.3e8xfjdw4e5p8eq4]{Terrifying Force} furious critical option.
  • While you are raging and frenzied, you gain the following additional benefits:
    • When you reduce a creature of a CR of at least half your character level to 0 hit points, you regain 2d12 hit points.
    • You can use your bonus action to make a single melee weapon attack.
    • If you are reduced to 0 hp, you remain conscious while making death saves, but your speed is halved and you no longer apply your ability score bonus to weapon damage. In addition, if you fail a 3rd death save and die, you cannot be returned to life by spells of less than 5th level.

effects.name: Raging and Frenzied
effects.description:
• You do not automatically exit frenzy or rage when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points or when you are no longer bloodied. Instead, you must make a Charisma saving throw against your maneuver DC with a bonus equal to the number of times you have failed this save to exit your rage.
  • Your movement speed increases by 20 feet and your jumping distance doubles.
  • When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a weapon attack against it.
  • When either your frenzy or your rage would end, you can choose to end both. You cannot choose to end your rage on your turn as a bonus action if you are also frenzied.
  • When you reduce a creature of a CR of at least half your character level to 0 hit points, you regain 2d12 hit points.
  • You can use your bonus action to make a single melee weapon attack.
  • If you are reduced to 0 hp, you remain conscious while making death saves, but your speed is halved and you no longer apply your ability score bonus to weapon damage. In addition, if you fail a 3rd death save and die, you cannot be returned to life by spells of less than 5th level.
